name: Ashley Quarters

reviews.text: After reading the reviews on TA, I was excited to book a 1 night stay at Ashley Quarters for a stop midway through our road trip. I didn't even balk at the $150 cost of a 2 queen + pullout couch and kitchenette room since everyone was praising the place to heaven.
reviews.title: Overprices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I found was perfectly run-of-the-mill roadside hotel that was starting to show its age. The front deck is tucked away in a tiny room filled with DVDs (which are free to borrow) and was staffed by one person who stayed on the phone with a caller, making me wait 5+ minutes to check in.
reviews.title: best hotel ever stay!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hallways smelled musty/disinfectant-y. The room was ice cold upon arrival. The pool area was quite nice and there is a grill and deck for patrons to use.
reviews.title: Comfortable, well-equipped rooms, in a professional, but friendly atmosphere

reviews.text: The kitchenette was adequate, but the bathroom left much to be desired. Yucky toiletries, a roll-in shower with a chair for the disabled and a fan that sounded like a jet landing. That and a toilet that flushed so violently my 3 year old refused to go near it!
reviews.title: Ashley Quarters Hotel Wonderful Service, Clean and Family Friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed linens were nothing special either--they reminded me of the polyester bedspreads I used to find at the Days Inn growing up.
reviews.title: Great Value with Creation Museum Package

reviews.text: The Ashley is definitely not a traditional hotel. Geared for extended stay guests, I stayed only one night, but felt very comfortable and very welcome.
reviews.title: Really Nice, Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was greeted by name as I walked in the door [lucky guess, but a very nice touch], and that set the tone for a very pleasant stay. My room was extremely clean and tidy with a full fridge, kitchen and large LCD TV with DVD player. Internet is wireless and no additional charge. The bed was quite comfy, with large pillows [no cheesy mini-pillows!].
reviews.title: Had a great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The layout of the hotel is a bit odd, but certainly nothing to complain about. Just unusual. The hotel has a decent exercise room also.
reviews.title: Verify that renovation is complete before booking this facility

likes.liked: — LG TV on the wall were only surpassed by the overall cleanliness
likes.disliked: — Inability to unlock doors other than entry door and only one key, plus rooms didn't lock automatically.

reviews.text: After a long day it was nice to be welcomed "home" and offered a movie to play on my DVD player.. I watched "Into the Wild"..
reviews.title: great location and value!

likes.liked: — full size kitchen, excellent for families
likes.disliked: — Florence traffic and construction can be annoying

reviews.text: My only minor complaint was the lack of a decent breakfast... Since this is really an extended stay hotel, I assume they expect you to pick up breakfast food and keep it in your room... Their house breakfast was an assortment of yogurt, wrapped pastries and some assorted other packaged foods.. and coffee of course, but no juice.. I managed to find enough to eat, but will try to remember to hit the nearby grocery and keep breakfast in my room next time.
reviews.title: Fantastic Little Hotel

reviews.text: Group of us stayed at this hotel for a week during a competition. It was awesome, large clean rooms and good staff. It was quiet and friendly. Almost looked forward to getting back there after a day at the stadium. Never a problem using the internet. Breakfast was ok, but found it best to have something in my kitchen in the room. BBQ and deck by the pool was awesome too. I'd run back to this hotel if in the area again.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the Northern Kentucky or Cincinnati area. It is not like any normal hotel. It has a very homelike feel and a wonderful staff to match. Our room was very spacious and well kept. We had a full kitchen in our room as well as a large flat screen TV. The free DVD rentals at the front desk were also a great touch! I would choose this hotel over a big chain hotel any day. Great Experience at Ashley Quarters!
reviews.title: We had a Great Stay!

likes.liked: — The Staff and the fully equipped suite
likes.disliked: — The fact that it is not a chain and that there are no others.

reviews.text: This was a great hotel located just outside of downtown Cincinnati! My husband was in town for business, so my two sons (age 5 & 2) and I went with him. Our room was right by the pool which was convenient. They recently added a covered deck just outside the pool area with a grill and picnic tables. It's a great place to lounge with your cocktail!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.liked: — Helpfulness of the staff and full kitchen in room
likes.disliked: — Free continental breakfast wasn't that great

reviews.text: The staff was fabulous! They did a great job of helping with directions and suggestions for kid-friendly local activities.
reviews.title: worst experience at a hotel ever

likes.liked: — they would not honor my reservation

reviews.title: great great stay
reviews.text: The location is good--there's a supermarket right behind the hotel and many good family-friendly restaurants close by.

Simular to Extended Stay - but a HUGE step up! We got a suite - very large and spacious and very CLEAN! Feels like a new resort! Is in front of a Grocer store - BIGGS- which is convenient. Parking is very well lighted - neighborhood felt safe and is right off the freeway and easy to find.
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.text: Breakfast was normal affair - can't complain is FREE!
reviews.title: fantastic service- Or should I say service with a smile

reviews.text: DOWNFALL - rooms use actual keys - prefer computer keys instead - there is not anyone on call after 11PM -
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet, Great Location - Recommend to anyone

reviews.text: Outdoor pool - very clean and private - and has Gas grill on patio - very nice!
reviews.title: VERY NICE HOTEL

likes.liked: — Clean,quiet and everything was very close by.

reviews.text: What a great place to stay. I was completely happy. Worth every penny.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

description: Enjoy true hospitality at Northern Kentucky's Premier Residential and Leisure hotel. Featuring wireless high-speed internet in every room and 42" plasma screen televisions in our Deluxe Executive Suites, Ashley Quarters is a comfortable alternative to the traditional hotel. If you're searching for a "temporary" home for business, pleasure, between homes or even for a short visit to Northern Kentucky -- experience our Legendary Service and Exceptional Value for yourself.
